 1913:     MS = [{['$1'], [MkMSCond(MkMSCond, 100)], []}],
 1914:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test([1], MS, trace)]),
 1915:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, MS, []),
 1916:     %% Now test a match spec using excessive nesting. This
 1917:     %% used to seg-fault the emulator due to recursion
 1918:     %% beyond the end of the C-stack.
 1919:     %%
 1920:     %% We expect to get a system_limit error, but don't
 1921:     %% fail if it compiles (someone must have rewritten
 1922:     %% compilation of match specs to use an explicit
 1923:     %% stack instead of using recursion).
 1924:     ENMS = [{['$1'], [MkMSCond(MkMSCond, 1000000)], []}],
 1925:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test([1], ENMS, trace)]),
 1926:     try
 1927:         _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, ENMS, []),
 1928:         {comment, "compiled"}
 1929:     catch
 1930:         error:system_limit ->
 1931:             {comment, "got system_limit"}
 1932:     end.
 1933: 
 1934: drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon) ->
 1935:     drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, false, 0, 0).
 1936: 
 1937: drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, TDRef, N, D) ->
 1938:     case receive Msg -> Msg end of
 1939:         {trace_delivered, Proc, TDRef} ->
 1940:             io:format("~p trace messages on 'DOWN'~n", [D]),
 1941:             io:format("Got a total of ~p trace messages~n", [N]),
 1942:             N;
 1943:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Proc, _} ->
 1944:             Ref = erlang:trace_delivered(Proc),
 1945:             drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, Ref, N, N);
 1946:         Trace when is_tuple(Trace),
 1947:                    element(1, Trace) == trace,
 1948:                    element(2, Trace) == Proc ->
 1949:             drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, TDRef, N+1, D)
 1950:     end.
 1951: 
 1952: tok_trace_loop(_, N, N) ->
 1953:     ok;
 1954: tok_trace_loop(Parent, N, M) ->
 1955:     Name = 'A really stupid name which I will unregister at once',
 1956:     link(Parent),
 1957:     register(Name, self()),
 1958:     unregister(Name),
 1959:     unlink(Parent),
 1960:     tok_trace_loop(Parent, N+1, M).
 1961: 
 1962: %% Waits for and returns the first message in the message queue.
 1963: 
 1964: receive_first() ->
 1965:     receive
 1966:         Any -> Any
 1967:     after 1000 ->
 1968:             timeout
 1969:     end.
 1970: 
 1971: %% Waits for and returns the first message in the message queue.
 1972: 
 1973: receive_first_trace() ->
 1974:     receive
 1975: 	Any when element(1,Any) =:= trace; element(1,Any) =:= trace_ts -> Any
 1976:     after 1000 ->
 1977:             timeout
 1978:     end.
 1979: 
 1980: %% Ensures that there is no message in the message queue.
 1981: 
 1982: receive_nothing() ->
 1983:     receive
 1984:         Any ->
 1985:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Any})
 1986:     after 100 ->
 1987: 	    ok
 1988:     end.
 1989: 
 1990: 
 1991: %%% Models for various kinds of processes.
 1992: 
 1993: process(Dest) ->
 1994:     receive
 1995:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 1996:             To ! What,
 1997:             process(Dest);
 1998:         {spawn_link_please, ReplyTo, {M, F, A}} ->
 1999:             Pid = spawn_link(M, F, A),
 2000:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, self(), Pid},
 2001:             process(Dest);
 2002:         {spawn_link_please, ReplyTo, Node, {M, F, A}} ->
 2003:             Pid = spawn_link(Node, M, F, A),
 2004:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, self(), Pid},
 2005:             process(Dest);
 2006:         {link_please, Pid} ->
 2007:             link(Pid),
 2008:             process(Dest);
 2009:         {unlink_please, Pid} ->
 2010:             unlink(Pid),
 2011:             process(Dest);
 2012:         {register_please, Name, Pid} ->
 2013:             register(Name, Pid),
 2014:             process(Dest);
 2015:         {unregister_please, Name} ->
 2016:             unregister(Name),
 2017:             process(Dest);
 2018:         {exit_please, Reason} ->
 2019:             exit(Reason);
 2020:         {exit_signal_please, Reason} ->
 2021:             exit(self(), Reason),
 2022:             process(Dest);
 2023:         {trap_exit_please, State} ->
 2024:             process_flag(trap_exit, State),
 2025:             process(Dest);
 2026:         Other ->
 2027:             Dest ! {self(), Other},
 2028:             process(Dest)
 2029:     after 3000 ->
 2030:               exit(timeout)
 2031:     end.
 2032: 
 2033: 
 2034: %% A smart process template.
 2035: 
 2036: process() ->
 2037:     receive
 2038:         {spawn_please, ReplyTo, Fun} ->
 2039:             Pid = fun_spawn(Fun),
 2040:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, Pid},
 2041:             process();
 2042:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 2043:             To ! What,
 2044:             process();
 2045:         timeout_please ->
 2046:             receive after 1 -> process() end;
 2047:         _Other ->
 2048:             process()
 2049:     end.
 2050: 
 2051: 
 2052: %% Sends messages when ordered to.
 2053: 
 2054: sender() ->
 2055:     receive
 2056:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 2057:             To ! What,
 2058:             sender()
 2059:     end.
 2060: 
 2061: 
 2062: %% Just consumes messages from its message queue.
 2063: 
 2064: receiver() ->
 2065:     receiver(infinity).
 2066: 
 2067: receiver(Timeout) ->
 2068:     receiver(receive
 2069: 		 {set_timeout, NewTimeout} -> NewTimeout;
 2070: 		 _Any -> Timeout
 2071: 	     after Timeout -> infinity  %% reset
 2072: 	     end).
 2073: 
 2074: %% Works as long as it receives CPU time.  Will always be RUNNABLE.
 2075: 
 2076: worker() ->
 2077:     worker(0).
 2078: 
 2079: worker(Number) ->
 2080:     worker(Number+1).
 2081: 
 2082: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
 2083:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
 2084: 
 2085: fun_spawn(Fun, Args) ->
 2086:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, Args]).
 2087: 
 2088: 
 2089: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine) ->
 2090:     case statistics(run_queue) of
 2091:         0 -> true;
 2092:         RQLen ->
 2093:             erlang:display("Waiting for empty run queue"),
 2094:             MSDL = DeadLine*1000,
 2095:             wait_for_empty_runq(MSDL, MSDL, RQLen)
 2096:     end.
 2097: 
 2098: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine, Left, RQLen) when Left =< 0 ->
 2099:     issue_non_empty_runq_warning(DeadLine, RQLen),
 2100:     false;
 2101: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine, Left, _RQLen) ->
 2102:     Wait = 10,
 2103:     UntilDeadLine = Left - Wait,
 2104:     receive after Wait -> ok end,
 2105:     case statistics(run_queue) of
 2106:         0 ->
 2107:             erlang:display("Waited for "
 2108:                            ++ integer_to_list(DeadLine
 2109:                                               - UntilDeadLine)
 2110:                            ++ " ms for empty run queue."),
 2111:             true;
 2112:         NewRQLen ->
 2113:             wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine,
 2114:                                 UntilDeadLine,
 2115:                                 NewRQLen)
 2116:     end.
 2117: 
 2118: issue_non_empty_runq_warning(DeadLine, RQLen) ->
 2119:     PIs = lists:foldl(
 2120:             fun (P, Acc) ->
 2121:                     case process_info(P,
 2122:                                       [status,
 2123:                                        initial_call,
 2124:                                        current_function,
 2125:                                        registered_name,
 2126:                                        reductions,
 2127:                                        message_queue_len]) of
 2128:                         [{status, Runnable} | _] = PI when Runnable /= waiting,
 2129:                                                            Runnable /= suspended ->
 2130:                             [[{pid, P} | PI] | Acc];
 2131:                         _ ->
 2132:                             Acc
 2133:                     end
 2134:             end,
 2135:             [],
 2136:             processes()),
 2137:     io:format("WARNING: Unexpected runnable processes in system (waited ~p sec).~n"
 2138:               "         Run queue length: ~p~n"
 2139:               "         Self: ~p~n"
 2140:               "         Processes info: ~p~n",
 2141:               [DeadLine div 1000, RQLen, self(), PIs]),
 2142:     receive after 1000 -> ok end.
 2143: 
 2144: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
 2145:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
 2146:         ok -> ok;
 2147:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 2148:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 2149:             Res
 2150:     end.
